info.title: Dynatrace
info.description: Dynatrace provides best-in-class observability through an open, AI-powered platform. This connector contains the endpoints for the Dynatrace Problems interface.

get.description: Lists problems observed within the specified timeframe.
Gets the properties of the specified problem.

parameters.name: problem_id
parameters.description: The ID of the required problem

get.summary: Get Problem Comment By Problem ID
get.description: Gets all comments on the specified problem

post.description: Adds a new comment on the specified Problem

get.summary: Get Problem Comment by Problem ID and Comment ID
get.description: Gets the specified comment on a problem.

parameters.name: problemId
parameters.description: The ID of the required problem

parameters.name: commentId
parameters.description: The ID of the required comment

get.description: Lists events within the specified timeframe

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the requested timeframe.

get.description: Gets the information about monitored entites

parameters.name: entitySelector
parameters.description: Defines the scope of the query. Only entities matching the specified criteria are included into response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the requested timeframe.

get.description: Gets the Properties of the Specified Monitored Entity

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The ID of the specified monitored entity

parameters.name: securityProblemSelector
parameters.description: Defines scope of the query. Only security problems matching the specified criteria are included in the response

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the requested timeframe

numberOfAffectedEntities.description: Vulnerable Components Number Of Affected Entities
Kubernetes Workload Number Of Affected Entities
Kubernetes Cluder Number Of Affected Entities
Related Container Number Of Affected Entities

get.description: Get parameters of a security problems

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the specified security problem

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A list of additional security problem properties you can add to the response. To add properties, specify them in a comma separated list and prefix each property with a plus (for example, +riskAssessment,+managementZones).
